meanings.definition: Twattling (verb): to gossip or chatter idly
meanings.sent1: She was twattling with her friends about the latest news.
meanings.sent2: Stop twattling and focus on your work.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside were twattling away, as if sharing secrets.
meanings.sent4: The stream twattled softly as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter twattled through the playground.

meanings.definition: Twattling (adjective): characterized by idle gossip or chatter
meanings.sent1: Her twattling neighbors always had something to say.
meanings.sent2: The twattling group could be heard from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The twattling cat seemed to be telling stories to itself.
meanings.sent4: The twattling wind carried their words far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The twattling atmosphere in the room made it hard to concentrate.

meanings.sent1: The twattling at the office was never-ending.
meanings.sent2: I try to avoid twattling as it only leads to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The twattling at the party was so loud it drowned out the music.
meanings.sent4: The twattling of the leaves in the wind created a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent5: The twattling of the brook was a calming sound in the forest.
